1.text: Man, born of woman, is of few days, and full of trouble.

2.text: He cometh forth like a flower, and is cut down; and he fleeth as a shadow, and continueth not.

3.text: Yet dost thou open thine eyes upon such a one, and bringest me into judgment with thee?

4.text: Who can bring a clean [man] out of the unclean? Not one!

5.text: If his days are determined, if the number of his months is with thee, [and] thou hast appointed his bounds which he must not pass,

6.text: Look away from him; and let him rest, till he accomplish, as a hireling, his day.

7.text: For there is hope for a tree: if it be cut down, it will sprout again, and its tender branch will not cease;

8.text: Though its root grow old in the earth, and its stock die in the ground,

9.text: Yet through the scent of water it will bud, and put forth boughs like a young plant.

10.text: But a man dieth, and is prostrate; yea, man expireth, and where is he?

11.text: The waters recede from the lake, and the river wasteth and drieth up:

12.text: So man lieth down, and riseth not again; till the heavens be no more, they do not awake, nor are raised out of their sleep.

13.text: Oh that thou wouldest hide me in Sheol, that thou wouldest keep me secret until thine anger be past, that thou wouldest appoint me a set time, and remember me,â€”

14.text: (If a man die, shall he live [again]?) all the days of my time of toil would I wait, till my change should come:

15.text: Thou wouldest call, and I would answer thee; thou wouldest have a desire after the work of thy hands.

16.text: For now thou numberest my steps: dost thou not watch over my sin?

17.text: My transgression is sealed up in a bag, and thou heapest up mine iniquity.

18.text: And indeed a mountain falling cometh to nought, and the rock is removed out of its place;

19.text: The waters wear the stones, the floods thereof wash away the dust of the earth; and thou destroyest the hope of man.

20.text: Thou prevailest for ever against him, and he passeth away; thou changest his countenance, and dismissest him.

21.text: His sons come to honour, and he knoweth it not; and they are brought low, and he perceiveth it not.

22.text: But his flesh hath pain for himself alone, and his soul mourneth for himself.
